definitions: electronic device allowing voice communication between different rooms or buildings
examples: Please use the intercom to call the reception desk
The teacher announced the fire drill over the school intercom

definitions: state of being connected with each other through shared links or relationships
examples: The interconnection between global markets affects local economies
Scientists study the interconnection of ecosystems in nature reserves

definitions: physical sexual activity between people involving genital contact
social communication or dealings between individuals or groups
examples: Sexual intercourse should always involve consent between adults
The doctor discussed safe intercourse practices with patients
Diplomatic intercourse between nations requires careful protocol
Commercial intercourse has increased between the two countries

definitions: condition where two or more things depend on each other for support or survival
examples: The interdependence of plants and pollinators maintains ecosystems
Economic interdependence between countries creates both opportunities and risks

definitions: authoritative prohibition or ban issued by a court or religious authority
examples: The court issued an interdict preventing publication of the story
The papal interdict forbade religious services in the region

definitions: action of prohibiting or forbidding something especially by legal or military means
examples: Drug interdiction efforts focus on stopping smuggling at borders
The naval interdiction prevented weapons from reaching the conflict zone

definitions: action of interfering or state of being interfered with causing disruption
examples: Radio interference made the broadcast difficult to hear clearly
Parents complained about government interference in education decisions

definitions: temporary interval of time between two events or provisional arrangement
examples: She served as interim director until a permanent replacement arrived
The interim report showed promising results for the research project

definitions: device or mechanism that connects parts together preventing independent operation
examples: The safety interlock prevents the machine from starting accidentally
The puzzle pieces interlock to create a complete picture

definitions: arrangement where parts fit together or connect in a mutually dependent way
examples: The interlocking pieces of evidence built a strong legal case
Corporate boards with interlocking directorships raise governance concerns

definitions: person who takes part in a dialogue or conversation with another
examples: The skilled interlocutor kept the diplomatic negotiations moving forward
She found her interlocutor's arguments both challenging and stimulating

definitions: short period of time between main events or temporary entertainment between acts
examples: The peaceful interlude between storms allowed repairs to begin
Musicians performed a musical interlude while stage sets were changed

definitions: marriage between people of different races religions or social groups
examples: Intermarriage between communities has increased social integration over time
Historical laws prohibiting intermarriage have been ruled unconstitutional

definitions: person who acts as a link between people to assist agreement
examples: The lawyer served as intermediary in the business negotiations
Financial intermediaries help connect borrowers with potential lenders

definitions: coming between two things in time place order or character
examples: Students progress from beginner through intermediate to advanced levels
The intermediate stage of the project requires careful quality control

definitions: act or ceremony of burying a dead person in a grave or tomb
examples: The interment took place at the family cemetery plot
Archaeological excavations revealed ancient interment practices and burial goods

definitions: short connecting instrumental movement in an opera or other musical work
examples: The orchestra performed a delicate intermezzo between the dramatic acts
Brahms composed several beautiful intermezzos for solo piano

definitions: pause or break between parts of a play concert or other performance
examples: Refreshments are available in the lobby during the intermission
The twenty-minute intermission allowed the audience to stretch and socialize

definitions: student or recent graduate working to gain practical experience in profession
examples: The medical intern worked long hours at the teaching hospital
Summer interns gain valuable experience while contributing to company projects

definitions: process of absorbing knowledge values or patterns into one's own thinking
examples: The internalization of cultural values begins in early childhood development
Therapy helped address the internalization of negative self-beliefs

definitions: political principle advocating greater cooperation among nations and peoples worldwide
examples: Post-war internationalism led to the creation of the United Nations
Economic internationalism promotes free trade between all countries

definitions: person who advocates or supports cooperation between nations over nationalism
examples: The internationalist argued for stronger global institutions and treaties
Many internationalists support humanitarian intervention to protect human rights

definitions: medical doctor specializing in diagnosis and treatment of internal organ diseases
examples: The internist ordered blood tests to diagnose the mysterious symptoms
Many internists serve as primary care physicians for adult patients

definitions: state of being confined as a prisoner especially for political or military reasons
examples: The internment of citizens during wartime remains a controversial policy
Former internment camps now serve as historical museums and memorials

definitions: position as a trainee or apprentice to gain practical work experience
examples: Her internship at the law firm led to a full-time job offer
Medical students must complete internships before practicing independently

definitions: ability of computer systems or software to exchange and use information
examples: Software interoperability allows different programs to share data seamlessly
Military forces require interoperability for effective joint operations

definitions: way in which two or more things influence each other through interaction
examples: The interplay between genetics and environment shapes human development
Artists explore the interplay of light and shadow in their work

definitions: insertion of something into existing text or estimation of values between known points
examples: Scholars identified later interpolations in the ancient manuscript text
Mathematical interpolation helps estimate missing data points in research

definitions: person who translates spoken words from one language to another
computer program that executes instructions written in programming language
examples: The court interpreter translated testimony for non-English speaking witnesses
Professional interpreters work at international conferences and diplomatic meetings
The Python interpreter executes code line by line during development
JavaScript interpreters in web browsers run code on client machines

definitions: professional activity of translating spoken language between different languages in real time
examples: Simultaneous interpreting requires intense concentration and language skills
She studied interpreting to work at international organizations

definitions: period when normal government is suspended especially between successive reigns or regimes
examples: The interregnum following the king's death created political uncertainty
During the interregnum, a council of nobles governed the kingdom

definitions: formal and systematic questioning especially by police or military personnel
examples: The suspect underwent hours of interrogation at the police station
Interrogation techniques must comply with human rights laws and standards

definitions: word used in questions such as what where when or how
examples: Students learned to use interrogatives when forming questions in English
The interrogative pronoun 'who' begins many mystery novel titles

definitions: person who questions someone closely aggressively or formally especially in official contexts
examples: The skilled interrogator obtained crucial information through patient questioning
Military interrogators receive specialized training in interview techniques

definitions: action of interrupting or being interrupted causing a break in activity
examples: Constant interruptions made it difficult to concentrate on work
The power interruption caused computers to shut down unexpectedly

definitions: point or area where two or more roads streets or paths cross
examples: Traffic lights control the flow at busy urban intersections
The accident occurred at the intersection of Main and First Street

definitions: person born with reproductive or sexual anatomy that doesn't fit typical male or female categories
examples: Medical understanding of intersex conditions has evolved significantly over time
Intersex advocates work to protect children from unnecessary medical procedures

definitions: major highway in the United States connecting different states
examples: The interstate highway system revolutionized American transportation and commerce
Heavy trucks use the interstate to transport goods across the country

definitions: person who answers questions in an interview for job media or research
examples: The interviewee prepared thoroughly for tough questions about their experience
Researchers protect the identity of interviewees in sensitive studies

definitions: person who asks questions in an interview for employment media or research
examples: The interviewer asked probing questions about the candidate's qualifications
Television interviewers must think quickly to follow up on answers

definitions: long tube-shaped organ in the digestive system where food is absorbed
examples: The small intestine absorbs most nutrients from digested food
Doctors examined the patient's intestine using advanced imaging technology

definitions: Palestinian uprising against Israeli occupation particularly those beginning in 1987 and 2000
examples: The first intifada began with civil disobedience and escalated over time
Historians analyze the intifada's impact on Middle Eastern politics

definitions: close familiarity or friendship involving private and personal knowledge or experience
examples: Building intimacy in relationships requires trust and open communication
The novel explores themes of emotional intimacy between characters

definitions: action of frightening or threatening someone to make them do what you want
examples: Workplace intimidation creates hostile environments and reduces productivity
Voter intimidation at polling places violates democratic principles

definitions: unwillingness to accept views beliefs or behavior that differ from one's own
examples: Religious intolerance has caused conflicts throughout human history
Food intolerance can cause digestive problems and discomfort

definitions: rise and fall of the voice in speaking expressing meaning or emotion
examples: English intonation patterns help distinguish questions from statements
The actor's perfect intonation brought the character to life

definitions: state of being drunk or under the influence of drugs affecting physical and mental control
examples: Public intoxication can result in arrest and legal consequences
The doctor assessed the patient's level of alcohol intoxication

definitions: private network within an organization using internet protocols for internal communication
examples: Employees access company resources through the corporate intranet portal
The hospital intranet allows secure sharing of patient information

definitions: refusal to change one's views or to agree about something despite reason
examples: Political intransigence prevented compromise on important legislative issues
The negotiator's intransigence ultimately led to failed peace talks

definitions: verb that does not take a direct object in a sentence
examples: The verb 'sleep' is intransitive because you cannot sleep something
Students learn to identify intransitive verbs in grammar lessons
